metadata.title: CVE-2016-3180 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Tor Browser Launcher (aka torbrowser-launcher) before 0.2.4, during theinitial run, allows man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass the PGP signatureverification and execute arbitrary code via a Trojan horse tar file and asignature file with the valid tarball and signature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3180` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

torbrowser-launcher - 0.2.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: torbrowser-launcher package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.4-1').
